data.title: One of the very best places in town. Superb wine list. Delicious food. Just go.
data.text: You can eat inside and you'll be very comfortable and happy, but try to sit outside in the courtyard and enjoy the way this restaurant ought to be experienced. The food is expertly prepared and the service is professional. Wine list is superb. One of the very best places in Santa Barbara. Highly recommended.

data.title: Excellent cuisine
data.text: We went on Saturday evening, having chosen this location based on TripAdvisor listing.  We were originally planning to order entrees from the menu, but on our server's recommendation, we decided to try and the five-course pre fixe dinner. She said the pre fixe was "chefs choice," so each course was a surprise.  The presentation and creative, complexity of flavors rivaled many Michelin star restaurants we've experienced.  Many unique ingredients-- powdered beet dust, dehydrated soy sauce and yuzu, crisp dried strawberries, apple, onion & whole grain mustard sauce.  The wine list is also exceptional and sommelier was very well versed on local winemakers.  We highly recommend this restaurant!

data.title: Lovely surprise around the corner
data.text:
We were looking for a nice lunch outside in Santa Barbara and wandered into a courtyard where we found the Wine Cask. As the name suggest they had a nice wine list and I had a lovely fresh and fruity glass of rosé and my friend had a wonderful Pinot Gris. 
We share the calamari with the cilantro sauce to start. Yummy !!
Our main course was classic creatively put together. I had filet mignon enchilada with big chin is of filet mignon no tomato sauce but a delicate green chili drizzle with a black bean risotto. Really nice !! My friend had a flatbread covered in artichoke hearts , basil and a delicate melted cheese sprinkle. 
Don't miss it.  It is right off State Street , the main shopping area.

data.title: Quaint Courtyard Setting...
data.text: I loved the privacy of this restaurant. Its down an alley way. We sat in the courtyard. There is a small fountain in the center and the sound of the water adds to the experience. My friend and I both had salads. They were fresh and delicious. The cocktails as well. If I am fortunate enough to visit Santa Barbara again I will eat at Wine Cask again.

data.title: Perfect Spot for a Leisurely Mid-Week Lunch
data.text: I had lunch recently at the Wine Cask, after a long absence, and it was a great experience.  We shared the mixed green salad then I had the Filet Mignon Enchiladas while my companion chose the Herb-Crusted Salmon; both were absolutely delicious: seasoned and cooked to perfection !  The service was excellent without being intrusive and, while we opted not to make selections from the wine list, it was extensive and balanced.  All in all, a wonderful lunch.  I can't wait to have dinner there !

data.title: Excellent!
data.text: This was recommended by Ana, the concierge at Bacara. And she was right! This turned out to be one of the best meals we had during our 10 days in Cali. We enjoyed lunch in the courtyard. If they have their tomato soup when you go, at least start with that. The two salads and scallops were also perfection. And the prices were surprisingly decent. Highly recommend!

data.title: Gourmet in Santa Barbara at it's best
data.text: The Wine Cask is one of Santa Barbara's fine dinning restaurants, there food is seasonal and experimenting with new innovations and ideas constantly.  It's located in the old El Paseo buildings, has a lovely little courtyard with a fountain, nice for lunches and mild evenings.  This time we had roasted Duck, mixed organic field greens, a small watermelon appetizer, The seared Sea Scallops with vegetables. so good. And we splurged on their special Chef's dessert.  We had a very nice Melville Chardonnay, considering the Wine tasting and shop (they have the best in town)great selection although a bit pricey.

data.title: Delicious food and the best of local wines
data.text: A friend suggested the Wine Cask as one of her favourite local haunts. It is located in charming downtown Santa Barbara and has a valet parking lot adjacent to the restaurant. There is both indoor and outdoor dining and we chose to sit outside on the patio which was pleasant on a balmy summer's evening. We looked at the wine list and my heart sank as there were mainly local wines on the list. I am very familiar with Bordeaux and Napa wines, but I know so little about the wines of this area. I needn't have worried as the extremely charming and knowledgeable manager, David, gave us expert advice and helped us to choose the most divine white and red wines. The menu is not extensive, but there is plenty to choose from. I ordered the kale salad to start which had roasted beets, pistachios and peach dressing. It was fresh and perfect for a summer's night. For my main course, I had wild Pacific salmon with an herb crust and it was accompanied by flavoursome lentils in a light broth. My husband had the roasted rib eye. He ordered it medium-rare and it was cooked to perfection.  The service and food were wonderful and it is certainly one of our memorable Santa Barbara dining experiences.

data.title: Beautiful meeting room for a large group
data.text: We went there with my husband's business associates and spouses and children. The room they had set aside for us was gorgeous. We had a set menu and all of the selections were very nice and full of flavor. They had some couches set up around a fireplace which made for the perfect place for the kids to hang out with each other after they ate. The staff was also very good at accommodating diners with celiac's disease. It was a great night!

data.title: Excellent laid back dining
data.text: We stumbled in here on our first night.  A block off of State Street, so the vibe was much more casual than everything over there.  Locals populated the place, excellent food and very good wine list.  A good server was training a not-so-good beginner, but probably worth going there just to enjoy the historical ceiling.

data.title: Intermezzo - a place for a flatbread and a some local wine
data.text: Here you will find both the old school Calif menu and partly modern kitchen.European-style alfresco is a nice alternative to the somewhat drab décor of the wine bar.Nice and relaxed attitude of staff

data.title: Excellent cuisine and locarion
data.text:
We had house guests so we went here instead of the san Ysidro ranch or the el Encanto. We had drinks at the el Encanto for the view and then came here for dinner.  
We had just returned from France where I ate foie gras every day. I ordered the foie gras terrine, thinking it would be mixed with other things, but I was delighted to see it was pure foie gras shaped in a terrine without other items, just not a bloc. It was some of the best I've had. I failed to ask if it was New York or California, but the only thing that would have made it better was to have had brioche toast instead of sourdough (there's a new bakery that makes brioche here). 
Other dinner orders were good, too. 
A lavender crême brûlée was good with a thick sugar crust, but I couldn't taste lavender. 
The Margerum Rhone is a perfect rouge. 
A tip: the valet parking is expensive and sometimes difficult to retrieve your car, so find some street parking if possible.

data.title: Dinner was weak especially for the price.
data.text: I had the seabass, it was dry,  coworkers scallops were so salty she could only eat one.  My husbands ribeye was pretty good though.  Lava chocolate cake was dry also,  as well as the chocolate chip cookie that had ice cream on it.  Very pricy especially since it wasn't that good.

data.title: Flat-Out great Flatbread
data.text: My dog and I enjoyed a patio luncheon at this noted place, and it was really an outstanding meal. The dog had fresh water delivered under the table, and I relished a slightly mexican flatbread with a glass of great chard. The service was so attentive...I am sure it was my cute dog, not me, that attracted one wait person after another to make sure we were fine and enjoying ourselves. The table next to me had an array of starters and each one looked delicious. I don't give many places five stars but I can't wait to return and get this flatbread again!

data.title: Nice location to celebrate special occasions
data.text: We had booked online via Open Table and a week before the reservation got a call from the hostess asking if it was ok to be seated in the courtyard as they were having a special event inside which restricted space. I said that was fine and it was a lovely evening, thank goodness. Sommelier was very helpful and made a suggestion which fit the bill perfectly. Fish was delicious as was the steak. No complaints. They asked us about dessert and despite having mentioned it was my birthday, did not take this off the bill. It's not like we expect it, but all the other restaurants gave us one dessert to share and didn't charge us for it. The waiter was perfectly friendly, but lacked a bit of personality.

data.title: Awful, has fully made the descent from the best in the area to poor
data.text:
I'm sorry I can't say anything nice about the Wine Cask any longer.  We've lived here for 15 years and visit four or five times per year, and each time things have gotten worse.  The menu is staid, the service is terrible, the food's flavors are bland and "Sysco" like even though they claim Farmer's Market influences.  

Our meal was lunch today.  My salad was almost inedible, cold grey shrimp (instead of the grilled shrimp that was described in the menu) over very coarsely chopped greens with minimal dressing.  The salad had large chunks of endive making the lettuce bitter and hard to eat.  The display itself was unappetizing - a pile of very large pieces of asparagus stems (what did they do with the tops?), peeled radishes, and the aforementioned undeveined grey shrimp.

Service was awful.  I asked for some bread.  I was advised it would be about ten minutes as they only provided bread on request at lunch, and it took 20.  After the bread, we never saw our wait staff or a bus person or anyone again.  After a half hour, we left a couple of twenty's on the table and went somewhere else for dessert and coffee.

It is sad.  This was our paramount best, for all occasions in SB.  Beautiful room, great location, and access to some of the best ingredients year round.  They could do so much better.

data.title: Anniversary dinner
data.text: We were recommended to try this favorite restaurant by our daughter, who has said is her favorite restaurant in Santa Barbara. We were not disappointed. We had the wild mushroom soup to start then wild mushroom risotto to go with the Rib Eye which was one of the best I have ever had, my wife agreed and she is not a real carnivore. I highly recommend this place anytime you are in the Santa Barbara area.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: Had a family meal in their event room for a rehearsal dinner - it was a 10/10 experience including planning and execution. Fabulous service. Lovely room. Great wine. Food was delicious and cooked well especially for a good sized crowd. Desserts were to die for! I'd love to go back for a date night!

data.title: Not for the nervous...but worth the wait!
data.text: The food, however is worth the wait.  If you're doing a biz lunch with limited time, go elsewhere, but if you're doing a leisurely lunch and particularly a supper, this place has FABULOUS food.  It reminds me a little of fine dining in Italy, where you'd better not be in a rush.  I had scallops and Kat a perfectly cooked chicken and a wonderful salad.  If you're a foodie, you'll love this place.  Join me ljmartin dot com author of mysteries, westerns and thrillers.

data.title: Disappointed
data.text: Our last visit to the Wine Cask was memorable-- wonderful food in a beautiful dining room. Our recent meal was very disappointing. The appetizers were delicious ( grilled octopus and duck rillette with foie gras) and it was downhill from there. They ran out of sea bass by 7:30 and served us wahoo which  was dry and hard. Our shared dessert was a 2 inch ($10.00) tarte tatin, a mushy apple mixture on a piece of thick dough. Oh dear!!!
